TypeSignature.Value: public interface IModerator<TState> where TState : ITurnState<StateBase,StateBase,TempState>

.class public interface auto ansi abstract IModerator`1<(class Microsoft.Teams.AI.State.ITurnState`3<class Microsoft.Teams.AI.State.StateBase, class Microsoft.Teams.AI.State.StateBase, class Microsoft.Teams.AI.State.TempState>) TState>
type IModerator<'State (requires 'State :> ITurnState<StateBase, StateBase, TempState>)> = interface

Docs.typeparam: Type of the applications turn state.
Docs.summary: A moderator is responsible for reviewing and approving AI prompts and plans.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Planner.Plan> ReviewPlan (Microsoft.Bot.Builder.ITurnContext turnContext, TState turnState, Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Planner.Plan plan);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Planner.Plan> ReviewPlan(class Microsoft.Bot.Builder.ITurnContext turnContext, !TState turnState, class Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Planner.Plan plan) cil managed
Public Function ReviewPlan (turnContext As ITurnContext, turnState As TState, plan As Plan) As Task(Of Plan)

Docs.param: Context for the current turn of conversation.
Application state for the current turn of conversation.
Docs.summary: Reviews a plan generated by the planner before its executed.
Docs.returns: The plan to execute. Either the current plan passed in for review or a new plan.
Docs.remarks:
The moderator can review the plan to ensure it's appropriate for the current conversation.
To approve a plan simply return the plan that was passed in. A new plan can be returned to redirect to a new set of actions. Typically the moderator will return a new plan with a single DO command that calls to flag the output for review.
The moderator can pass any entities that make sense to the redirected action.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Planner.Plan?> ReviewPrompt (Microsoft.Bot.Builder.ITurnContext turnContext, TState turnState, Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Prompt.PromptTemplate prompt);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Planner.Plan> ReviewPrompt(class Microsoft.Bot.Builder.ITurnContext turnContext, !TState turnState, class Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Prompt.PromptTemplate prompt) cil managed
Public Function ReviewPrompt (turnContext As ITurnContext, turnState As TState, prompt As PromptTemplate) As Task(Of Plan)

Docs.param: Context for the current turn of conversation.
Application state for the current turn of conversation.
Docs.summary: Reviews an incoming utterance and generated prompt before it's sent to the planner.
Docs.returns: A null value to approve the prompt or a new plan to redirect to if not approved.
Docs.remarks:
The moderator can review the incoming utterance for things like prompt injection attacks or the leakage of sensitive information. The moderator can also review the generated prompt to ensure it's appropriate for the current conversation.
To approve a prompt, simply return null. Returning a new plan bypasses the planner and redirects to a new set of actions. Typically the moderator will return a new plan with a single DO command that calls to flag the input for review.
The moderator can pass any entities that make sense to the redirected action.
